sentence.Network_en: The team seems to have shaken off the jinx that's been dogging them for months.
sentence.Network_cn: 这支队伍好像已经摆脱了数月来一直缠着他们的厄运.

sentence.Network_en: He kept dogging my tracks all the way to London.
Confound him , what does he mean by dogging me?
sentence.Network_cn: 该死的家伙, 他干吗老盯住我 呢 ?

entry.def: A dog is a very common four-legged animal that is often kept by people as a pet or to guard or hunt. There are many different breeds of dog.

entry.tran: 公狗;犬科雄兽(雄狐、雄狼等)
entry.def: You use dog to refer to a male dog, or to the male of some related species such as wolves or foxes.

example.ex: Is this a dog or a bitch?

entry.def: If someone calls a man a dog, they strongly disapprove of him.

entry.tran: 蹩脚货;粗制滥造的东西
entry.def: People use dog to refer to something that they consider unsatisfactory or of poor quality.
If someone, especially a man, calls a woman or girl a dog, they mean that she is very ugly, unattractive, or boring.

example.ex: How can you go out with her? She's a real dog.
example.tran: 你怎么能和她谈恋爱呢？她简直就是个恐龙。

entry.def: If problems or injuries dog you, they are with you all the time.

example.ex: The problems that have dogged him all year are just a temporary setback...
example.tran: 一时的挫折竟困扰了他一整年。

example.ex: His career has been dogged by bad luck.
example.tran: 他在事业上一直不走运。

entry.tran: （带有赌博性质的）赛狗会，跑狗
entry.def: The dogs is a sports meeting where dogs, especially greyhounds, race and people bet on which dog will win.
You describe something as a dog's breakfast or dog's dinner in order to express your disapproval of it, for example because it is very untidy, badly organized, or badly done.

example.ex: The whole place was a bit of a dog's dinner, really...
example.tran: 整个地方乌烟瘴气的，真的。

example.ex: Our own Board are going to make a dog's breakfast out of it if we aren't careful.
example.tran: 如果我们不小心行事，我们的董事会就会乱成一团。

entry.tran: 狗咬狗;残酷无情的竞争;自相残杀
entry.def: You use dog eat dog to express your disapproval of a situation where everyone wants to succeed and is willing to harm other people in order to do so.

example.ex: It is very much dog eat dog out there...
The TV business today is a dog-eat-dog business.
example.tran: 当前电视业的竞争残酷无情。

entry.def: If you say that something is going to the dogs, you mean that it is becoming weaker and worse in quality.

example.ex: They sit in impotent opposition while the country goes to the dogs.
example.tran: 国家败落之际，他们加入了软弱无力的反对党。

entry.def: If someone tells you to let sleeping dogs lie, they are warning you not to disturb or interfere with a situation, because you are likely to cause trouble and problems.

example.ex: Why can't she let sleeping dogs lie?
example.tran: 为什么她就不能不多事？

entry.tran: 不接受新事物;不喜欢新玩意儿
entry.def: If you say 'You can't teach an old dog new tricks', you are suggesting that someone is unwilling to try new ways of doing things.

means.word_mean: 1. relentless and indefatigable in pursuit or as if in pursuit;

auth_sentence.content: The allegations add to others dogging France's former presidency.
auth_sentence.res_content: The allegations add to others dogging France's former presidency.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The allegations add to others dogging France's former presidency.

auth_sentence.content: His girlfriend Sarah was getting on very well with her new dogging pal.
auth_sentence.res_content: His girlfriend Sarah was getting on very well with her new dogging pal.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His girlfriend Sarah was getting on very well with her new dogging pal.

auth_sentence.content: The tablet threat is dogging Microsoft even though most of its business is thriving.
auth_sentence.res_content: The tablet threat is dogging Microsoft even though most of its business is thriving.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The tablet threat is dogging Microsoft even though most of its business is thriving.
